A B C D E F G H I K L M N P R S T U V

A

About - Class in ChessGameKenai
About class extends JDialog and is used to simply display the about window.
About(ChessBoardView) - Constructor for class ChessGameKenai.About
Overloaded constructor which receives a reference to the ChessBoardView class only to set the location of the dialog in front of the main game.
acceptFile() - Method in class ChatProject.PublicFileTransfer
The method acceptFile is called when the user clicks accepts the file download the socket will be created with the IPAddress of the client that wants to send he already has a ServerSocket object that is waiting for the connection when the connection is established transfer begins right away
addListener() - Method in class ChessGameKenai.VisualPiece
The method addListener adds a listener to this object as needed by programmer
addListeners(Color) - Method in class ChessGameKenai.Board
The method addListeners adds the listeners to the specified color it loops through the list of visual pieces and adds the listeners to the specified color pieces
addUserName(String) - Method in class ChatProject.ServerGUI
This method addUserName is synchronized to make sure that only one thread a a time could execute this method The acquired key is only released by the executing thread when it is done with the method Why this method needs to be synchronized because it is called in the session thread but we could have thousands of sessions so then there will be high probability that a least once on method will be called at the same time This method simply adds the user name to the userNames list
analyzeAndDisplay(Object) - Method in class ChatProject.Client.Receive
The analyzeAndDisplay method simply receives an object as the parameter then analyzes it then does what ever is needed depending on the object contents Instead using strings with protocol its much easier to send whole objects and extract the instance variables accordingly and do what is necessary depending on what variable is not null some methods in the client class are called solely by the analyze method when the object contain a certain data which is needed to know what method to call and when the analyzed object is sent down to the appropriate method and that will do what we want like display message, show an icon send files etc.........
analyzeAndDisplay(Object) - Method in class ChatProject.PrivateChatWindow
The analyzeAndDisplay method simply receives an object as the parameter then analyzes it then does what ever is needed depending on the object contents Instead using strings with protocol its much easier to send whole objects and extract the instance variables accordingly and do what is necessary depending on what variable is not null
analyzeAndDisplay(Object) - Method in class ChatProject.ServerGUI.Server
The analyzeAndDisplay method simply receives an object as the parameter then analyzes it then does what ever is needed depending on the object contents Instead using strings with protocol its much easier to send whole objects and extract the instance variables accordingly and do what is necessary depending on what variable is not null
analyzeAndExecute(Object) - Method in class ChessGameKenai.ConnectionBridge.ReadData
The analyzeAndExecute method receives an object that the ReadData class has just read from the socket this method analyzes it and calls appropriate methods to update the view like change icon, display message, restart game or list of two integers that the move method will be called with
appendStr(String, SimpleAttributeSet, Color) - Method in class ChessGameKenai.Chat
appendStr is used to append messages, this method had to be made because JTextPane doesn't include a append() method
appendString(String, SimpleAttributeSet, Color) - Method in class ChatProject.Client
The method appendString simply appends the String to the textPane The way it does is pretty much straight forward it inserts the String into the Document which in turn displays it on the Pane I also used StyleConstants for color Font and etc.......
appendString(String, SimpleAttributeSet, Color) - Method in class ChatProject.PrivateChatWindow
The method appendString simply appends the String to the textPane The way it does is pretty much straight forward it inserts the String into the Document which in turn displays it on the Pane I also used StyleConstants for color Font and etc.......
